Text.Value: Last night was... an exception. I hope you understand that. The battle's won, our journey is over, and I need to take my place at Lady Shar's side.

EditorData.NodeContext: Composing herself, morning after the night before. Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

Text.Value: You need to return to Avernus. Look for a cure, fight on - whatever it takes. Just don't give up.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unwilling to let go. Speaking to Karlach, her lover who is going to die because of an infernal engine burning up inside her. Arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: *You try to focus on Shadowheart's words, but the inferno inside is burning your mind clean.*
It's not an exciting life that I lead, but I'd like you to be a part of it. I doubt I'd have anything at all if it wasn't for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere. Shadowheart abandoned Shar and saved her parents

Text.Value: I think so, yes. At least for now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shadowheart spent the night with her lover, who transformed themselves into a mind flayer in order to save the world. Bittersweet parting of ways between lovers who can no longer easily be together.

Text.Value: Ah, dead parents. The perfect post-coital subject.
You stood by me when Bhaal possessed me... We have faced so much worse together...
I see... Well, if you change your mind, I'll keep myself easy to find.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little disappointed. Overall arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: I can't. Lady Shar needs me. Her children need someone to lead them - my place is with them.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Arc: SH stayed with Shar and sacrificed her parents.
Shadowheart spent the night with her lover, who transformed themselves into a mind flayer in order to save the world. Bittersweet parting of ways between lovers who can no longer easily be together.

Text.Value: But who knows? Perhaps we'll meet again. Though hopefully not after being abducted. Be good. And if you can't be good... just don't get caught.

Text.Value: Come. Let's get you some fresh air. I'll stay with you, right until the end.

Text.Value: I'm glad you finally found your place in the world.
May Lady Shar's darkness cloak you and shield you. You will find few friends in the light of day, but you can still count on me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shadowheart spent the night with her lover, who transformed themselves into a mind flayer in order to save the world. Bittersweet parting of ways between lovers who can no longer easily be together.

Text.Value: It was special, but also fleeting... as it was always going to be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wistful. Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

Text.Value: Perhaps that's wise... I'm still figuring out who I am. Unfair to ask you to commit to an unknown quantity.

EditorData.NodeContext: Understanding.  Overall arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: I can't, I'm sorry. My place is here. Lady Shar needs me. Her children need me.

Text.Value: You don't know what you're saying. Avernus is the worst possible place for you to end up.
What did you have in mind?
...but after all we've been through, I really should know better than to doubt you, shouldn't I?

EditorData.NodeContext: Conceding a little. Maybe they CAN make it work

Text.Value: I couldn't let you do that.
Plus Raphael will have Zariel distracted. You can be free of her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unwilling to let go. Speaking to Karlach, her lover who is going to die because of an infernal engine burning up inside her. Arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: If you're sure. I'll return to the Hells with you. We'll make a new life - a different life.
You and I... our time together has been very dear to me. I had hoped maybe there might be more to come.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tentative, hopeful. Shadowheart abandoned Shar and saved her parents

Text.Value: You cried out in your sleep last night.
I'd like nothing more.
I suppose in a way, you finally finished the journey your parents set you upon.
I'll never go back - I'm sorry. I just want to see the sky one more time before I go.
After what this city's been through, people will scarcely tolerate cuttlefish at the fishmonger's stall - never mind a full-blown mind flayer in their midst.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shadowheart spent the night with her lover, who transformed themselves into a mind flayer in order to save the world. Bittersweet parting of ways between lovers who can no longer easily be together.

Text.Value: More than I thought would be possible, considering the short time we had...

EditorData.NodeContext: Wistful. Overall arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: Besides, I think I'm due a sabbatical.

EditorData.NodeContext: Playful.

Text.Value: Perhaps we shouldn't - it might just reopen old wounds.

Sorry. Thought I'd catch you in the afterglow.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry, Overall arc: Shadowheart mercy-killed her parents in order to end Shar's control over them and her.

Text.Value: ...but we made our choices, and must live with what we have - and what we've lost.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Such is life'. Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

Text.Value: All right - let's try. We've gotten this far, after all. Just... let me do the explaining, to my parents. They've been through a lot - I'd rather they didn't die of shock.

EditorData.NodeContext: Throwing caution to the wind. Maybe she CAN make it work with her monster lover. A little playful at the end.
EditorData.logicalname: PARENTS ALIVE - ABANDONED SHAR PATH LAST MINUTE

Text.Value: Such a thing must exist, surely... so I refuse to call this farewell. Just 'until next time'.

Text.Value: Who would do such a thing for religion?

Text.Value: No, Shadowheart. You deserve a better life than that. And so do I.
You'll find what you need. I'm sure of it.
Now is the time to spread her word: so many have suffered greatly in recent times, gripped by pain and loss... They will rush to the Dark Lady's embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

Text.Value: But I made it in the end.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content. Shadowheart abandoned Shar and saved her parents

Text.Value: But I'll keep myself easy to find, in case you change your mind. You may come to miss me yet.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keeping the door half open for love interest. Shadowheart abandoned Shar and saved her parents

Text.Value: You're right. I can always rely on you to say the right thing.

EditorData.NodeContext: Appreciative. Shadowheart abandoned Shar at the last minute and saved her parents

Text.Value: Last night was... an experience. But I don't think you've changed quite as much as some might think. I'd recognise that vigour anywhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: Contemplative/voicing an irrational fear. Shadowheart abandoned Shar and saved her parents

Text.Value: What if you just... didn't take up your place?

EditorData.NodeContext: Arc: A little thrown by the question. Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar, ultimately sacrificing (and subsequently forgetting) her parents, before assuming control over Shar's church.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little taken aback.

Synopsis:
Shadowheart and her love interest player talk in a private bedroom in an inn, the morning after spending the night together after saving the world. A discussion of what comes next ensues, varying depending on how Shadowheart's story unfolded. She could:
- have remained committed to Shar and have sacrificed her parents. She is now in charge of Shar's church.
- she could have abandoned Shar at the last moment and saved her parents
- she could have turned from Shar in Act 2, and set out on a mission to save her parents in Act 3, rescuing them
- she could have turned from Shar in Act 2, and set out on a mission to save her parents in Act 3, but instead euthanized them to free them from Shar's curse.
- none of the above are applicable, and she is aware she has unfinished (and undefined) business she needs to tend to.
